   "source": [
    "# Signaux élémentaires\n",
    "\n",
    "Différents signaux seront régulièrement utilisés dans le cours : ils sont définis ici.\n",
    "La plupart peuvent être définis à temps continu ou à temps discret."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Sinusoïde\n",
    "\n",
    "En temps continu, la sinusoïde a pour expression :\n",
    "\n",
    "$$\n",
    "  x(t) = A \\sin(2 \\pi f t + \\varphi)\n",
    "$$\n",
    "\n",
    "où :\n",
    "* $A$ est l'_amplitude_\n",
    "* $f$ est la _fréquence_\n",
    "* $\\varphi$ est le _déphasage_\n",
    "\n",
    "Remarquez que :\n",
    "* si $\\varphi=0$, alors $x(t)$ est un sinus,\n",
    "* si $\\varphi=\\pi/2$, alors $x(t)$ est un cosinus.\n",
    "\n",
    "La sinusoïde en temps continu est une [fonction périodique](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fonction_p%C3%A9riodique) de période $1/f$ ou, de manière équivalente, de fréquence $f$.\n",
    "\n",
    "En temps discret, la sinusoïde a la même expression\n",
    "(sauf que les parenthèses autour de la variable de temps\n",
    "sont remplacées par des crochets) :\n",
    "\n",
    "$$\n",
    "  x[n] = A \\sin(2 \\pi f n + \\varphi)\n",
    "$$\n",
    "\n",
    "Le sinus est créé en Python avec la fonction [`numpy.sin`](https://numpy.org/doc/stable/reference/generated/numpy.sin.html)."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 7,
   "metadata": {
    "tags": [
     "remove-input"
    ]
   },
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "\n",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 720x216 with 2 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {
      "needs_background": "light"
     },
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "import math\n",
    "import numpy as np\n",
    "import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n",
    "\n",
    "n = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)\n",
    "a1, f1, phi1 = 1, 10, 0\n",
    "a2, f2, phi2 = 2, 3, math.pi/3\n",
    "x1 = a1 * np.sin(2*math.pi*f1*n + phi1)\n",
    "x2 = a2 * np.sin(2*math.pi*f2*n + phi2)\n",
    "\n",
    "plt.figure(figsize=(10,3))\n",
    "plt.subplot(1,2,1)\n",
    "plt.plot(n,x1)\n",
    "plt.xlabel(\"$t$\")\n",
    "plt.ylabel(\"$x(t)$\")\n",
    "plt.title(\"A = 1, f = 10, φ = 0\")\n",
    "plt.ylim([-2.1, 2.1])\n",
    "plt.subplot(1,2,2)\n",
    "plt.plot(n,x2)\n",
    "plt.xlabel(\"$t$\")\n",
    "plt.ylabel(\"$x(t)$\")\n",
    "plt.title(\"A = 2, f = 3, φ = π/3\")\n",
    "plt.ylim([-2.1, 2.1])\n",
    "plt.show()"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Exponentielle complexe\n",
    "\n",
    "En temps continu, l'exponentielle complexe a pour expression :\n",
    "\n",
    "$$\n",
    "  x(t) = \\exp(j 2 \\pi f t + \\varphi)\n",
    "       = \\cos(2 \\pi f t + \\varphi) + j \\sin(2 \\pi f t + \\varphi)\n",
    "$$\n",
    "\n",
    "L'exponentielle est créée en Python avec la fonction [`numpy.exp`](https://numpy.org/doc/stable/reference/generated/numpy.exp.html),\n",
    "et le nombre complexe $j$ est obtenu avec `1j`."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Sinus cardinal"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 12,
   "metadata": {
    "tags": [
     "remove-input"
    ]
   },
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "\n",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 720x216 with 1 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {
      "needs_background": "light"
     },
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "import math\n",
    "import numpy as np\n",
    "import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n",
    "\n",
    "n = np.arange(-8, 8, 0.01)\n",
    "x = np.sinc(n)\n",
    "\n",
    "plt.figure(figsize=(10,3))\n",
    "plt.plot(n,x)\n",
    "plt.xlabel(\"$t$\")\n",
    "plt.ylabel(\"$x(t)$\")\n",
    "plt.title(\"sinc(t)\")\n",
    "plt.show()"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [

    "## Impulsion de Dirac"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 22,
   "metadata": {
    "tags": [
     "remove-input"
    ]
   },
   "outputs": [
    {

      "image/png": "\n",

       "<Figure size 720x216 with 1 Axes>"

     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n",
    "\n",
    "x = .2\n",
    "y = .95\n",
    "n = [-10, 0, 0, -x, 0, x, 0, 0, 10]\n",
    "d = [ 0, 0, 1,  y, 1, y, 1, 0,  0]\n",
    "\n",
    "plt.figure(figsize=(10,3))\n",
    "plt.plot(n,d)\n",
    "plt.xlabel(\"$t$\")\n",
    "plt.ylabel(\"δ(t)$\")\n",
    "plt.show()"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Impulsion discrète\n",
    "\n",
    "L'impulsion discrète est également appelée impulsion de Kronecker.\n",
    "\n"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 28,
   "metadata": {
    "tags": [
     "remove-input"
    ]
   },
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "\n",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 720x216 with 1 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {
      "needs_background": "light"
     },
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n",
    "\n",
    "n = np.arange(-10, 10)\n",
    "d = np.where(n==0, 1, 0)\n",
    "\n",
    "plt.figure(figsize=(10,3))\n",
    "plt.plot(n, d, '.')\n",
    "plt.xlabel(\"$t$\")\n",
    "plt.ylabel(\"δ(t)$\")\n",
    "plt.show()"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "## Peigne de Dirac\n",
    "\n",
    "Le peigne de Dirac est défini par :\n",
    "\n",
    "$$\n",
    "  Ш_T(t) = \\sum_{k=-\\infty}^{+\\infty} \\delta(t-kT)\n",
    "$$\n",
    "\n",
    "Le peigne de Dirac est également appelé train d'impulsion, fonction d'échantillonnage ou distribution Cha (en raison de sa ressemblance avec la lettre cyrillique Ш)."
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "**ne pas représenter le sigal : le laisser en exercice**"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",

   "outputs": [

     "data": {
      "image/png": "\n",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 720x216 with 1 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {
      "needs_background": "light"
     },
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n",
    "\n",
    "# Flèche\n",
    "x = .2\n",
    "y = .95\n",
    "arrow_x = np.array([0, 0, -x, 0, x, 0, 0])\n",
    "arrow_y = np.array([0, 1,  y, 1, y, 1, 0])\n",
    "\n",
    "# Couleur\n",
    "prop_cycle = plt.rcParams['axes.prop_cycle']\n",
    "colors = prop_cycle.by_key()['color']\n",
    "clr = colors[0]\n",
    "\n",
    "# Affichage\n",
    "plt.figure(figsize=(10,3))\n",
    "plt.plot([-10, 10], [0, 0])\n",
    "for i in range(-9, 10, 3):\n",
    "    plt.plot(arrow_x+i, arrow_y, color=clr)\n",
    "plt.xlabel(\"$t$\")\n",
    "plt.ylabel(\"Ш(t)$\")\n",
    "plt.title(\"Peigne de période 3\")\n",
    "plt.show()"
   ]
  },
